p: Pandemics are simultaneous global transmission of emerging and re-emerging infectious disease epidemics affecting large amounts of people, often resulting in substantial deaths and social and economic disruption ( Madhav et al., 2017). In recent years growing outbreaks of infectious disease, such Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2003 ( Maunder, 2004), novel influenza A / H1N1 (swine flu) in 2009 ( Fitzgerald, 2009) and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) in 2012 ( Kim, 2018), have suggested a potential global pandemic ( Seale et al., 2009). The discovery of novel coronavirus Corona Virus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Wuhan, China in December 2019 brought this potential to realization ( Huang and rong Liu, 2020).
